PublicKeyCredential.summary: The PublicKeyCredential interface provides information about a public key / private key pair, which is a credential for logging in to a service using an un-phishable and data-breach resistant asymmetric key pair instead of a password. It inherits from , and is part of the Web Authentication API extension to the Credential Management API.

blockquote.para: This API is restricted to top-level contexts. Use from within an iframe element will not have any effect.

remarks.para: -The parent interface

PublicKeyCredentialAuthenticatorAttachme.summary: The authenticatorAttachment read-only property of the interface is a string that indicates the general category of authenticator used during the associated or call.
PublicKeyCredentialAuthenticatorAttachme.value: A string, which will be one of the following values:

PublicKeyCredentialGetClientCapabilities.summary: The getClientCapabilities() static method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object that can be used to check whether or not particular WebAuthn client capabilities and extensions are supported.

remarks.para: A relying party (RP) can use this information to appropriately customize its sign-in and sign-up user interfaces and workflows.
-Web Authentication API

PublicKeyCredentialGetClientCapabilities.returns:
A that resolves to an object where the property names are the client capability strings, and the values are boolean values that indicate whether or not the corresponding capability or extension is supported.The WebAuthn client capability strings are:The web extension strings are formatted by prefixing the extension identifier with the prefix extension:.
For example, the key extension:appid can be used to check if the appid extension is supported.

PublicKeyCredentialGetClientExtensionRes.summary: The getClientExtensionResults() method of the interface returns an object mapping the identifiers of extensions requested during credential creation or authentication, and their results after processing by the user agent.

remarks.para: During the creation or fetching of a PublicKeyCredential (via and respectively), it is possible to request "custom" processing by the client for different extensions, specified in the publicKey option's extensions property. You can find more information about requesting the different extensions in Web Authentication extensions.

blockquote.para: getClientExtensionResults() only returns the results from extensions processed by the user agent (client). The results from extensions processed by the authenticator can be found in the authenticator data available in .

remarks.para:
-The list of the currently defined extensions
- which contains the
result of the authenticator's extensions processing

PublicKeyCredentialGetClientExtensionRes.returns: An object with each entry being an extensions' identifier string as the key, and the output from the processing of the extension by the client as the value.

PublicKeyCredentialId.summary:
The id read-only property of the
interface is a string, inherited
from , which represents the identifier of the current
PublicKeyCredential instance.

remarks.para: This property is a base64url encoded version of .

blockquote.para:
This property may only be used in top-level contexts and will
not be available in an iframe for example.

PublicKeyCredentialId.value: A string being the base64url encoded version of .

PublicKeyCredentialIsConditionalMediatio.summary: The isConditionalMediationAvailable() static method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} which resolves to true if conditional mediation is available.
PublicKeyCredentialIsConditionalMediatio.returns: A which resolves to a boolean value indicating whether or not conditional mediation is available.

PublicKeyCredentialIsUserVerifyingPlatfo.summary: The isUserVerifyingPlatformAuthenticatorAvailable() static method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} which resolves to true if a user-verifying platform authenticator is present.

remarks.para: A user-verifying platform authenticator is a kind of multi-factor authenticator that is part of the client device (it is generally not removable) and that involves an action from the user in order to identify them. Common user-verifying platform authenticators include:

blockquote.para: This method may only be used in top-level contexts and will not be available in an iframe for example.

remarks.para:
-Windows Hello
-Web Authentication and Windows Hello - MSDN Guide and especially the special considerations mentioning isUserVerifyingPlatformAuthenticator()

PublicKeyCredentialIsUserVerifyingPlatfo.returns:
A which resolves to a boolean value indicating whether or a not a user-verifying platform authenticator is available.
NOTEIn earlier versions of the specification, the boolean also conveyed the consent of the user to disclose such an authenticator existed.

PublicKeyCredentialParseCreationOptionsF.summary: The parseCreationOptionsFromJSON() static method of the interface creates a object from a JSON representation of its properties.

remarks.para: The method is a convenience function for converting credential options information provided by a relying party server to the form that a web app can use to create a credential.

-Web Authentication API
-
-

PublicKeyCredentialParseRequestOptionsFr.summary: The parseRequestOptionsFromJSON() static method of the interface converts a {{glossary("JSON type representation")}} into a instance.

remarks.para: The method is a convenience function for converting information provided by a relying server to a web app in order to request an existing credential.

-Web Authentication API
-

PublicKeyCredentialRawId.summary:
The rawId read-only property of the
interface is an {{jsxref("ArrayBuffer")}} object
containing the identifier of the credentials.

remarks.para: The property is a base64url encoded version of this identifier.

blockquote.para:
This property may only be used in top-level contexts and will
not be available in an iframe for example.

PublicKeyCredentialRawId.value:
A containing the identifier of the credentials. This
identifier is expected to be globally unique and is appointed for the current
PublicKeyCredential and its associated
.

PublicKeyCredentialResponse.summary:
The response read-only property of the
interface is an
object which is sent from the authenticator to the user agent for the creation/fetching
of credentials. The information contained in this response will be used by the relying
party's server to verify the demand is legitimate.

remarks.para: An AuthenticatorResponse is either:

In order to validate the creation of credentials, a relying party's server
needs both:

blockquote.para:
When validating the fetching of existing credentials, the
whole PublicKeyCredential object and the client extensions are necessary
for the relying party's server.

This property may only be used in top-level contexts and will
not be available in an iframe for example.

PublicKeyCredentialResponse.value:
An object containing the data a relying party's
script will receive and which should be sent to the relying party's server in order to
validate the demand for creation or fetching. This object contains data from the client
() and from the authenticator.

PublicKeyCredentialSignalAllAcceptedCred.summary: The signalAllAcceptedCredentials() static method of the interface signals to the authenticator all of the valid credential IDs that the relying party (RP) server still holds for a particular user.

remarks.para: This allows the authenticator to update credential information, removing all credentials that are no longer recognized by the RP, such as those for deleted accounts. The method should be called each time a user authenticates with the RP.

signalAllAcceptedCredentials() should only be called when the current user is authenticated — after sign up or sign-in, or when the user deletes a credential — as it exposes sensitive information belonging to the user.

-
-
-Keep passkeys consistent with credentials on your server with the Signal API on developer.chrome.com (2024)

PublicKeyCredentialSignalCurrentUserDeta.summary: The signalCurrentUserDetails() static method of the interface signals to the authenticator that a particular user has updated their user name and/or display name on the relying party (RP) server.

remarks.para: This allows the authenticator to update user account details, to make sure they stay in sync with those held by the RP. It should only be used when the current user is authenticated — after sign in, or when they change the metadata associated with their credentials on the RP web app.

-
-
-Keep passkeys consistent with credentials on your server with the Signal API on developer.chrome.com (2024)

PublicKeyCredentialSignalUnknownCredenti.summary: The signalUnknownCredential() static method of the interface signals to the authenticator that a credential ID was not recognized by the relying party (RP) server.

remarks.para: This allows the authenticator to remove credentials that are not allowed by the RP, such as those for deleted accounts, or accounts that were created and stored on the authenticator but not properly updated on the server. Generally the method is called after sign in fails because the account details were not available to the RP. It can be used even when the current user is not authenticated because it does not expose sensitive information.

-
-
-Keep passkeys consistent with credentials on your server with the Signal API on developer.chrome.com (2024)

PublicKeyCredentialToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method of the interface returns a {{glossary("JSON type representation")}} of a .

remarks.para: The properties of the returned object depend on whether the credential is returned by navigator.credentials.create() when creating a key pair and registering a user, or navigator.credentials.get() when authenticating a user.

This method is automatically invoked when web app code calls JSON.stringify() to serialize a so that it can be sent to relying party server when registering or authenticating a user.
It not intended to be called directly in web app code.

-Web Authentication API
-
-

PublicKeyCredentialToJSON.returns:
A JSON type representation of a PublicKeyCredential object.The included properties depend on whether the credential was returned by navigator.credentials.create() on registration, or navigator.credentials.get() when authenticating a user.
The values and types of included properties are the same as for PublicKeyCredential, with the exception that base64url-encoded strings are used in place of buffer properties.The object properties are:
